description: The "synthetic.wishlists" table represents customer wishlists, where each wishlist is uniquely identified by a "wishlist_id" and associated with a "customer_id" indicating its owner. The table includes attributes such as "wishlist_name" for the title of the wishlist, whether it is "is_public" for visibility, and timestamps "created_at" and "updated_at" to track changes. This table is primarily used to manage data for customer wishlists but currently does not explicitly reference or connect with other tables through defined relationships.

columns.name: wishlist_id
columns.description: This column uniquely identifies each wishlist within the system, incrementing with each new entry. It serves as a primary key to track individual wishlists.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.description: This column represents the unique identifier for different customers who have created wishlists. Each number corresponds to a distinct customer.

columns.name: wishlist_name
columns.description: The column represents custom names given to collections or lists of desired items or entities, presumably created by users. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: is_public
columns.description: Indicates whether a wishlist is publicly accessible or not. A value of true means the wishlist can be viewed by others, while false signifies it is private.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when each wishlist entry was created, reflecting the instance in the standard time zone of the creator. The default value suggests that it logs the creation timestamp automatically, though entries can be updated to null.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column records the most recent date and time when a wishlist record was updated. It reflects changes or modifications made to the wishlist entries.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX wishlists_pkey ON synthetic.wishlists USING btree (wishlist_id)
